Activity: Arrive at the hospital, grab a coffee, and check emails for any urgent updates or requests from the team. Start browsing some medical journals about the seasonal influenza trends to get more insights.
Review the week's goals: Update the nursing assessment workflow and modify the physician examination workflow for influenza diagnosis and testing.

Meet with @rn-1, @rn-2, @rn-3, @pchmp-1 to discuss the current nursing assessment workflow and gather input on how to best incorporate a standardized assessment for influenza symptoms. @PEOPLE: Discuss Nursing Assessment Workflow Updates for Influenza Symptoms
Based on the discussion with the nursing team, create a draft of the updated nursing assessment workflow, outlining specific questions and observations related to influenza symptoms.
Share the draft nursing assessment workflow with @rn-1, @rn-2, @rn-3 for their review and feedback. @PEOPLE: Review of Draft Nursing Assessment Workflow
Lunch Break. Catch up with colleagues in the cafeteria.
Review the feedback received from the nurses on the draft assessment workflow. Make necessary revisions and improvements based on their suggestions.

Meet with @pchmp-1 to discuss modifying the physician examination workflow to include prompts for influenza diagnosis and testing. Understand their perspective on the current process and identify areas for improvement. @PEOPLE: Physician Examination Workflow Modification for Influenza

Based on the discussion with the physician champion, create a draft of the modified physician examination workflow, including prompts for influenza diagnosis, testing options, and relevant clinical guidelines.
Share the draft physician examination workflow with @pchmp-1 for their review and feedback. @PEOPLE: Review of Draft Physician Examination Workflow
Review the plan for tomorrow. Prepare the documents for tomorrow's meeting.
